availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Granville Love Maret (Rockcastle Co., capt. 7th Ky. Vol. Inf.)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Bowman Maret in Whitley County, Kentucky, in July of 1861. Father of John A. Maret and Glatha Maret. Farmer in Whitley County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as captain from September 22, 1861, to June 10, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Whitley County, Cumberland River, p. 819.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, District 1, p. 28B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Whitley County Marriages, Film #000532098, p. 94-5.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 761.
